avoid-mapping-selectorslink

Avoid mapping logic outside the selector level.

  • Type: suggestion
  • Recommended: Yes
  • Fixable: No
  • Suggestion: No
  • Requires type checking: No
  • Configurable: No

Rule Detailslink

A selector is a pure function that is used to derive state. Because a selector is a pure function (and it's synchronous), it's easier to test.

That's why it's recommended to put (mapping) logic into a selector, instead of in the component by using the RxJS map operator.

Examples of incorrect code for this rule:

export class Component { name$ = this.store .select(selectLoggedInUser) .pipe(map((user) => ({ name: user.name }))); }

Examples of correct code for this rule:

// in selectors.ts: export selectLoggedInUserName = createSelector( selectLoggedInUser, (user) => user.name ) // in component: export class Component { name$ = this.store.select(selectLoggedInUserName) }
